skill.name: clojure-review
skill.description: Review Clojure and ClojureScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style violations, and code quality issues. Use when reviewing pull requests or diffs containing Clojure/ClojureScript code.
skill.summary: Review Clojure and ClojureScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style v...
skill.author: metabase

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and code review guidelines. No executable code, no network access, no file writing capabilities beyond what the allowed tools provide. Uses only Read, Grep, Bash, and Glob tools for code review purposes.

content.value_statement: This skill reviews Clojure and ClojureScript code for compliance with Metabase coding standards. It checks for style violations, code quality issues, and follows established review guidelines for pull requests and code diffs.
actual_capabilities: Review Clojure code against Metabase style guide
Check test organization and naming patterns
limitations: Does not modify code or create files
Only reviews code in the local repository

use_cases.title: PR Code Review
use_cases.description: Review pull requests containing Clojure code for style and quality issues

use_cases.title: API Endpoint Review
use_cases.description: Validate REST API endpoints follow naming and schema conventions

use_cases.title: Test Standards Check
use_cases.description: Ensure tests follow naming and organization patterns

prompt_templates.title: Quick Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the Clojure file at [filepath] for style guide compliance. Check naming, documentation, and organization.

prompt_templates.title: PR Review
prompt_templates.scenario: Review changed files in a PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the changed Clojure files in this diff against the Metabase style guide. List all violations found.

prompt_templates.title: API Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the API endpoint code in [namespace] for proper REST conventions, schema definitions, and parameter handling.

prompt_templates.title: Full Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete code review on the Clojure code in [directory/module]. Check naming, documentation, organization, tests, and API conventions. Report all findings.

output_examples.input: Review src/metabase/models/user.clj for style guide compliance
output: NAMING ISSUES: Function 'get-user' should be named 'user' (pure functions are nouns)
ORGANIZATION: Consider marking helper functions as ^:private
TESTS: Test name 'user-test' is correct (ends with -test)

best_practices: Review entire diffs to understand context and scope of changes
Use the quick review checklist for efficient scanning
Focus on violations that linters cannot catch (naming, documentation quality)
anti_patterns: Posting congratulations for following style guidelines
Reviewing code without checking the Metabase style guide first

faq.question: Does this skill modify code?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads and reviews code. It does not write files or apply fixes automatically.

faq.question: What coding standards does it check?
faq.answer: It checks Metabase Clojure style guide including naming, documentation, organization, and API conventions.

faq.question: Can it review ClojureScript too?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill reviews both Clojure and ClojureScript code with the same standards.

faq.question: Is my code safe during review?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads files using Read, Grep, and Glob tools. No data is sent externally.

faq.question: Does it integrate with CI/CD?
faq.answer: No. This skill runs interactively during code reviews. It does not automate CI processes.

faq.question: How is this different from clj-kondo?
faq.answer: This skill catches issues linters miss, like naming conventions, documentation quality, and architectural patterns.
